definitions.definition: The ability of the brain to record information or impressions with the facility of recalling them later at will.
definitions.example: Memory is a facility common to all animals.

definitions.definition: A record of a thing or an event stored and available for later use by the organism.
definitions.example: I have no memory of that event.

definitions.definition: The part of a computer that stores variable executable code or data (RAM) or unalterable executable code or default data (ROM).
definitions.example: This data passes from the CPU to the memory.

definitions.definition: The time within which past events can be or are remembered.
definitions.example: in recent memory; in living memory

definitions.definition: (of a material) which returns to its original shape when heated
(collective) A term of venery for a social group of elephants, normally called a herd.
